pipeline_aws package¶

Submodules¶

pipeline_aws.download module¶

Part D cf schema

pipeline_aws.download.download(annotator_name: str, bucket_json: str, bucket_image, local_storage: str = 'download', profile: str = 'default') → None¶

download via json and image which aren’t store in local. Edit json with path image folder.

Parameters

  • annotator_name – name of the user

  • bucket_json – bucket where json via are stored

  • bucket_image – bucket where image are stored

  • local_storage – path of the local storage where json and image are stored

  • profile – Choose AWS CLI profile if more than 1 are set up

pipeline_aws.download.download_via_json(annotator_name: str, bucket_name: str, local_storage: str = 'download', profile: str = 'default') → set¶

download the via json which contains the right annotator name from the bucket. Check local storage, if a file is already store, don’t download.

Parameters

  • annotator_name – name of the user

  • bucket_name – bucket where json via are stored

  • local_storage – path of the local storage where json via are stored

  • profile – Choose AWS CLI profile if more than 1 are set up

Returns

set of json download

pipeline_aws.ec2 module¶

Part C cf schema

pipeline_aws.ec2.run_generation(cloud_provider, region: str, table_name: str, batch_size: int, bucket_in: str, bucket_out: str, annotator_names: list, profile: str = 'default') → None¶

Get all image without annotator from dynamoDB. Generate json via with annotation by batch and upload to s3. update dynamoDB with annotator name.

Parameters

  • cloud_provider – cloud provider name “aws” for aws rekognition, “gcloud for gcloud vison

  • region – dynamoDB table region

  • table_name – dynamoDB table name

  • batch_size – batch size for via json

  • bucket_in – bucket with standardised image

  • bucket_out – bucket where via json are upload

  • annotator_names – list the name of all the annotator

  • profile – Choose AWS CLI profile if more than 1 are set up

pipeline_aws.rename_upload module¶

Part A cf schema

pipeline_aws.rename_upload.upload(user: str, folder: str, start: int, bucket_raw: str, profile: str = 'default')¶

Upload all the files of folder in AWS bucket, rename file with user name and number auto increment

Parameters

  • user – user name

  • folder – folder to upload

  • start – start for auto increment

  • bucket_raw – name bucket

  • profile – Choose AWS CLI profile if more than 1 are set up

Returns

the final number auto increment in order to save it
